page.title: 04Market Gardening Mickleton
page.content: Webb's market gardening holding was started in 1896 in Mickleton by Mr Joseph Webb Snr.It is now carried on by his great grandson Mr J Robbins. Mickleton had good ground for growing tomatoes.Fifty acres of ground are now cultivated.There are 12 acres used for greenhouses,but 6 acres of greenhouses are disused.They stopped growing sprouts ten years ago because of lack of labour.There are ten people employed full-time,6 people part-time and up to ten people in casual labour. The crops are sent to super markets all over the country.Plant pests and diseases are controlled by spraying both inside the greenhouses and out in the open.Nitrogen,potash and phosphates are the fertilisers which are used.All the workers are employed at the same level.
